intro: Calochortus elegans var. subclavatus, commonly known as the Sierra Valley mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes various species of mariposa lilies known for their showy, showy blooms. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its flowers are usually pink to lavender in color, with a distinctive, spurred petal structure. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
